Not useful for word processing or heavier duty functions. It's basically laptop light (which is both a pro and con).I think of it as a super remote control that I can carry around the house, taking the place of the simpler functions of my laptop.

Reviews.Title: Poor wi fi performance and customer service
Reviews.Author: A. Wertheim "werthla"
Reviews.Content: My IPAD 3 wi fi constantly slows down or loses connectivity after fifteen minutes in public wi fi spots. It does well at home.  In hotspots it's unusable.  I went twice to the apple store and a genius did a reset of wi fi networks, went out to test, no better, returned and requested an exchange as its still under warranty. The manager said their "process"requires a total system reset first.  So they reset it and I had to leave.  Still no good.Contrast this with customer service with Verizon where I had a defective earphone jack on a droid phone.  They took my word for it, shipped a new phone out immediately and a container to return the old phone.  You bet I will stay with them.My next tablet will be an Android.  Apple no longer has a monopoly on tablets which seems to elude them.A also have a Kindle Fire HD which is great.  I will have to make a third trip to the Apple store which is not convenient.After my third trip to the Apple store, they honored the warranty and gave me a new and working iPad 3.  I must say, the apps for the iPad work very well  give it an edge for now.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: grace
Reviews.Content: This was a great gift. It has many awesome things you can do. The IPad is very cool and fun.

Reviews.Title: Obsessed!!
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: Product was EXACTLY what I wanted.  Shipped quickly.  I spend everyday on this tablet.  Never opening my laptop again LOL

Reviews.Title: Inpecable Experience
Reviews.Author: Gerardo Martinez
Reviews.Content: Is everything it is advertised for. It was a gift for my daughter and she is very happy with it. I am thinking of getting one for myself  but probably will wait to see what will have to offer the new 5th generation.The delivery service was inpecable so overall, it was a great experience. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Obsessed!!
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: Product was EXACTLY what I wanted.  Shipped quickly.  I spend everyday on this tablet.  Never opening my laptop again LOL

Reviews.Title: Inpecable Experience
Reviews.Author: Gerardo Martinez
Reviews.Content: Is everything it is advertised for. It was a gift for my daughter and she is very happy with it. I am thinking of getting one for myself  but probably will wait to see what will have to offer the new 5th generation.The delivery service was inpecable so overall, it was a great experience. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I got this iPad for my wife for Christmas.  It came in perfect condition and works great. We all take turns using it on the wireless network and have had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad MD328LL/A (16 GB Wi-Fi White) 3rd Generation .
Reviews.Author: Bob & Evelyn Horacek
Reviews.Content: Bought the ipad for my wife . She really likes it . She says it is everything she expected . She is on it all the time . She tells everyone about it .

Reviews.Title: My 1st. I Pad
Reviews.Author: WVsunnydays
Reviews.Content: I really didn't know what I would use this jewel for.  Pretty user friendly and getting more familiar with it daily.  I mean you get no instructions with this thing except a web based users guide that I stumbled across.  I can watch Netflix on it now.  Needs a pretty good Wi-Fi signal though or else it looses contact with the web.  Would I pay this much again.  I doubt it.

Reviews.Title: I Pad Ratings:
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my wife and I now have my I Pad back, LOL. She really liking her own Pad and learning yet. The photos are awsome, Even Photos sent to her via I Phones are great quality. She is thinking she would of like to have the G3 over wi-fi so if you were to go on trip then apply for the G3 service only during those times.

Reviews.Title: Love the iPad
Reviews.Author: Erin L. Kirkpatrick
Reviews.Content: There is nothing really different between the 3 and the 4 so I thought I would save some money and get the 3.  It works and looks great.

Reviews.Title: I pad, 4G
Reviews.Author: James Poitras
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, love it.  Amazing unit, compact, fast.  Would defintily reccommend to others.  This one was a gift.  Can not wait to have one of my own..........Thanks JP

Reviews.Title: Exceed expectations
Reviews.Author: Belen Reyes
Reviews.Content: I Love my Ipad, you guys deliver on time the product. I will recomend my friends about your company. Exceeded esxpectations.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Shopper
Reviews.Content: Very good product.  The camera button takes more than one touch to work.  Also I notice the lower left corner is slow to work.  I may not have the right touch but I noticed everything else works on the first touch.  Thank you,

Reviews.Title: Very good service
Reviews.Author: Glenn T. Crane
Reviews.Content: very fast delivery, less than 5 days. Product was brand new in factory sealed box and was perfect. Wife just loves it.Christmas gift.Ipad ordered was "new Ipad" which i thought was Ipad 3, but IPad 4 was what I received.Very good seller.

Reviews.Title: she loves it
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: got as gift for wife, when she opened it ,you would of thought we hit the lotto,she uses it all day,must admit it is nice,and can do quite a bit with it, she is very happy with her ipad

Reviews.Title: I'm not an Apple fanboy...but...the screen clarity is no joke.
Reviews.Author: JSLES
Reviews.Content: Okay...I've gone through 8 tablets in 2 1/2 years in my house.  That includes two iPad 1st generation, Kindles, Asus Transformer, and Galaxy Tab 10.1 and Galaxy Tab 7.0  So clearly I'm not influenced by the Apple.  However, the retina display is by far the best clarity I've seen so far these past 10 months.  I think that the Android competitors need to step up their game.  They've had a couple of stumbles in 2012, after matching Apple throughout 2011.  We shall see.

Reviews.Title: Who doesn't like iPads
Reviews.Author: Doug "Doug"
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for my wife and the clarity is unbelievably better that the original.  I dont have to say more.  Buy it.

Reviews.Title: It's an iPad
Reviews.Author: MasterBlaster
Reviews.Content: Works as expected, no problems - verified it genuine via the apple serial number and apple web site for warranty purposes.

Reviews.Title: I Use It For Everything
Reviews.Author: Shanna Fouts
Reviews.Content: One device, I can organize my notes, read books, surf the internet, track my finances, I even downloaded a 3D modeling app so I can work on my 3D design when I'm not at my computer!

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Dinarte
Reviews.Content: very good experience, I recommend it widely, the shipment arrived on time. the product was exactly the that I wanted

Reviews.Title: IPad newbie
Reviews.Author: L. Vincent Ford
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review on the new iPad. I' still learning all of it's features. I' m more than happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Used is the way to go!
Reviews.Author: clubbem
Reviews.Content: I got this from one of the used resellers.  I have to say, I would never know that this was a used product.  It can in original packaging like new.  And I saved close to $200 going this route.  I replaced my ipad first gen with this one just so I can get the new IOS versions and use Facetime.  Since this does not have the new Lightning connection, all of my old charging cables and other accessories still work and now I can also enjoy the new Retina display.So anyone else looking to move from 1st gen iPad to new, unless you need the new processor or need 4G/LTE then iPad 3 is for you.  And save yourself the money by buying used from one of the Amazon resellers.

Reviews.Title: ipad 3rd generation
Reviews.Author: davris
Reviews.Content: Love this, we currently have 3 in our household, everyone wants their own.  Makes me want to trade in my android for iPhone.

Reviews.Title: I pad
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: Love this I -pad. Does everything I could ever think of doing. Received it even before they said I would get it. Super service

Reviews.Title: This is so cool!
Reviews.Author: Neva Johnson
Reviews.Content: I love having the web with me at all times!  I also enjoy the games and having Facebook at my fingertips.

Reviews.Title: Ipad
Reviews.Author: robert jones
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied about my purchase.  It's everything that I wanted in a iPad. I take it everywhere that I go.

Reviews.Title: I think the ipad is great, once we figure it out
Reviews.Author: Kerry M. Hartz
Reviews.Content: We seem to be having problems either getting a connection to the app store, and then problems downloading games/apps.  Often, it just says 'loading' for a long time.  Seems like if we turn it off and back on again, it works better, but it's as though each time we try to do a 'second thing' it struggles.  Maybe it's a modem issue, but my laptop has no problems with connectivity.  I think once we figure out how to use the new toy it will be great, but so far it's been frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Good tool for mobile connectivity and productivity
Reviews.Author: Ziad
Reviews.Content: Excellent product but I could not give 5 stars because I have realized more and more that Android is a way more intuitive and pleasing user experience. IOS6 seems boring for some reason when I go back to use the Ipad from my android device and so now I am having second thoughts of being caught in apple's eco system. That being said it did a good job for the purpose which we bought it which was to be connected and able to do stuff while we travel.

Reviews.Title: IPAD 4
Reviews.Author: Bill Young
Reviews.Content: good product but a bit overhyped.no instructions - you are expected to know what to do (I didn't since it wass my first apple product).The Samsung Galaxy would be a better value.

Reviews.Title: iPad 3rd gen. Fantastic !
Reviews.Author: A. L. H.
Reviews.Content: Easy to learn, very fast and love the screen size. Also, tech support was A+. This was my first apple purchase and I am totally happy.

Reviews.Title: Good choice
Reviews.Author: Minh Le
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of  interesting apps helping me explore the world around. But setting up is a little bit time consuming and sometime confusing.

Reviews.Title: The best Christmas present ever.
Reviews.Author: spielberglover
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas this year. I love it. It's just like a computer except with an easy touch screen. I hope everyone had wonderful holidays. In fact I am typing this review on my ipad 4. This baby has a redesigned retina display. I'm not sure why apple is not selling the ipad 3 anymore. Could you guys leave me a comment explaining this please? Anyway this would be a great device to get your child or teenager for x-mas or any time of the year really. The only thing that makes a gripe is the price. It is still worth it though. This device is also great for school, playing fun games through apps, and for work and job related business. Even if you want to have a little fun whether on car rides or long distance air flights. You'll love the ipad 4. MERRY CHRISTMAS AND HAPPY HOLIDAYS. Most have already pasted though. P.S.: Before I forget, HAPPY NEW YEAR! I accidentally made a mistake! SORRY! I clicked on the 3rd generation ipad instead of the 4ourth. They look the same though.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: pcas
Reviews.Content: it was everthing all rigth :) :) :) :) :):) :) :)  :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: Without any doubts, mac products always be the best
Reviews.Author: Shawn Para "Shawn Para"
Reviews.Content: iPad 3 32G is more valuable than ipad 4. Although new pad has retina, 32G is also worth a 5 star

Reviews.Title: The best portable gaming device!
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: When you download games on the Ipad 3 and start playing, the games have a very good resolution and all of the games are HD.  The applications are different on the Ipad 3 than the laptop or any personal computer.  It is easy to understand and use most of the different games.  The more difficult games to use are: Minecraft and Gravity Guy.  The games that require internet include: MetalStorm, DragonVale, and Battle Bears Royale.  Some good games that don't require internet include: Shufflepack, Fruit Ninja, Temple Run, Urban Crime, and Crash Drive.

Reviews.Title: IPAD 3 = FTW
Reviews.Author: Tillman H. Smoot
Reviews.Content: While the battery is a bit slow to charge, as long as you turn off location services and push notifications, this is a fantastic ipad. I had the original Ipad and this one is leaps light years ahead of it. Speed, image quality, everything about this Ipad, with the exception of the cost is fantastic.If you're thinking about a tablet, Ipad is really the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Kewl
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: I got it for her for Christmas. Bought it in october. She Hasn't put it down since before halloween. Itold her it still counts as a Christmas gift.

Reviews.Title: Its an apple product... Of coarse its a five star... And I am a PC guy
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I have an $8000 PC but I love apple products.  They don't release a product or feature until it works RIGHT.  You will have great resale value and great customer support.  The battery last a long time and the screen is fantastic.  Hurry up apple.  Make a retina display that I can use on my PC :)

Reviews.Title: Apple still has a leg up...
Reviews.Author: RBrandon "Grimm147"
Reviews.Content: I will never, ever use an iPhone. Android has got me with their million customizations and options when it comes to mobile phones. However, when it comes to tablets, they still have a long way to go.The iPad simply is designed to teach anyone who picks it up should be able to figure out how to use it. That is great for most of the population, and for me most days. Having a program (iTunes) that allows for being able to connect to the computer can also make a big difference when you want to quickly add movies/tv shows/ Outlook data.The closed eco system that is Apple can be annoying, especially when I can customize my phone far more then my tablet, but until Android begins to unify a bit more in their tablets, I will stay with the iPad.

Reviews.Title: I Pad
Reviews.Author: Noel
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this purchase.  It came as expected and I was a little leary about ordering something like this on line, but it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Debigonz
Reviews.Content: It does its job and keeps me in touch with different networks. It is a Mac so of course there are many things not compatible with PC software. Other than that it's fine

Reviews.Title: Pad up
Reviews.Author: DelKar "DelKar"
Reviews.Content: All my reviews have been submitted from my iPad ... Not a big deal or need to boast .... At least I don't have to slug around my laptop or be confined to my PC desk. Apps are kool... Capacity is necessary for the pad... Plants vs Zombies is addicting! Get my morning news delivered to iBook so no wet paper! Still so much more!

Reviews.Title: You will not regret buying this, from a first timer here
Reviews.Author: Mike90125
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's that amazing.After  dealing with Windows for decades, seeing the iPad make you realize, Apple has always been about making great products, while Windows was always about selling you stuff.Buy this, I've used it for months and haven't even thought of looking for a manual, did it even come with one? Try that with a Windows computer. Even today, to set up one, unless you know *exactly* what to do, which is usually the *OPPOSITE* of what Windows recommends, the lay person can be driven to tears. Shame on Windows. To This Day, I get calls to set up peoples Windows from friends.This is why Apple makes Windows look like the bloated OS that it is. Buy a QWERTY keyboard if you are doing extensive text input, like writing a book. I Love this thing. You will too.

Reviews.Title: Love this iPad!! had it exchanged 4 times at the apple store.
Reviews.Author: J. Tregaro
Reviews.Content: I love my iPad!! only thing that bugged me is that I had to get it exchanged 4 times because there was always a defect with it, first one the screen was extremly yellow, second one had a line going through the screen, 3rd one the screen was yellow again, and then the 4 one had dead pixels, then the 5th ipad I got was perfect!!, I dont mind exchanging my apple products out for replacements but I think they should have better quality control. other then that I love my iPad, its the best, nothing can beat an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Retina Display is just stunning.
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: It's like seeing the world with glasses. I had an iPad 2 and I really liked it, but I wanted a better display but was kinda skeptical at first but I am so glad I switched over. Retina display is just beautiful... that said, I didn't notice anything else much different from iPad2 other than the display.

Reviews.Title: iPad
Reviews.Author: JOHNMOOD
Reviews.Content: This was our first Apple product.  Our iPad is going to replace our 10-year-old computer. so far we've had it for three weeks and we're very satisfied with it. the only downside is we can't print .I thought maybe that the iPod would be able to support an air printer maybe next time ,next generation , thank you sincerely John and Linda

Reviews.Title: This is a great iPad
Reviews.Author: david lagrone
Reviews.Content: I actually ended up selling this iPad back to Amazon because I needed more space on the flash drive, but for most people this is more than enough. There is no need to purchase the most recent version as the Apple iPad 3 is a very fast and capable tablet

Reviews.Title: What can I say?
Reviews.Author: Raymond P. Cattaneo "Ray"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best devices and most useful gadgets I've ever purchased.  I use it for everything from music reading to newspapers, etc.

Reviews.Title: Impressed with the Retina Display!
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: This is my second iPad.  Have had NO problems with it.  Seems to last a long time on a charge, but haven't really timed it.  Plenty of space - have over 25,000 digital photos on it.

Reviews.Title: Flora
Reviews.Author: Flora
Reviews.Content: The product is in accordance with the description. I am a student and I buy the iPad mainly for study, so I think it's a good deal, thanks.

Reviews.Title: Just what the doctor ordered
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Meets all expectations. Works great with my wi-fi system. Whole family uses it all the time. Would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad 3rd Generation
Reviews.Author: Patricia White
Reviews.Content: We love our iPad 3rd Generation it is more than meets our expectations!  It is so much faster than our computer.

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad 3rd Generation
Reviews.Author: Patricia White
Reviews.Content: We love our iPad 3rd Generation it is more than meets our expectations!  It is so much faster than our computer.

Reviews.Title: Perfect tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Danny Kongbounme
Reviews.Content: Well I alway been thinking about ipad. Now I found a good deal on Amazon so I brought it about 2 months ago. I been using this ipad more than my laptop of the time. I love the display images is so crispy. Now the ipad 4thGeneration is out on the market but, I'm very happy to own 3rdGeneration ipad. Ipad3 is very easy to use and I would recommend to everyone who looking for taplet device.

Reviews.Title: Good with one exception
Reviews.Author: Howard J Walker
Reviews.Content: The product itself is fine but as I ordered a black one I expected a black one. Only the face is black, the case behind is silver/aluminium colour and gives off reflections which I was trying to avoid.

Reviews.Title: Worth Every Penny
Reviews.Author: Chief
Reviews.Content: I knew this would be nothing more than a toy. I didn't know that I would become tethered to it. If you're looking to be productive (school / work,) a netbook may be better for you. If you're just looking for web surfing, games, magazines, radio and podcasts, and overall entertainment, treat yourself with an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Love my ipad!
Reviews.Author: Datlh
Reviews.Content: Well worth the money! I truly enjoy this iPad. I use it for work and for my personal business. I wished I got more GB's. Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Who needs a laptop?
Reviews.Author: Peggy
Reviews.Content: Since I got this IPad, it is my most used device. I got a great leather case here on Amazon too. I would highly recommend to anyone looking to buy a tablet.

Reviews.Title: iPad 3
Reviews.Author: Peter Ferguson
Reviews.Content: Very happy with product, not happy with Apple. Bought this iPad just days before they started selling iPad 4, I would have waited.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this mainly for my 5 year old to use. I love how easy it is to access the app store and download educational games and read a long books!

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Trainwreck
Reviews.Content: I gave this the highest rating for several reasons. One being I had not used any iPads before I bought this. I'm astounded about how easy this version is to use. I can do everything, just about, that I can do on the computer. I could go on and on but you got the idea. Delivery was outstanding, had it within a few days.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: L. Breda "L."
Reviews.Content: I would first like to say I DID NOT purchase this item on amazon because the markup is silly high. I have read allot of the amazon reviews and feel that some reviewers are very unfair on the product. So with that said please read my review if you are considering buying.I bought the 32GB wifi and Verizon 4G in whiteI currently own the retina display iPad in whiteIn the past I have owned the galaxy tab 10.1, the Samsung ativ pc pro, galaxy note, and kindle 8.9 HDI love the iPad mini. I think it is very practical for everyday use. It is easy to hold, battery life is excellent, typing is easy, equipped with a few movies, a few games, and the kindle AP you always have entertainment wherever you go in a small and beautiful form factor.Many people are raising a fuss about the non-retina display... This does not bother me even though my primary device before the mini has been the retina iPad. You can see pixels, it's not so beautifully crisp as the retina but it is still above adequate for reading, gaming, etc. after an hour or so of using this device I don't even notice the difference. I owned the kindle fire, and while the screen was HD and looked great I couldn't stand how tied to Amazon I was with it (sorry amazon I love you)  and well... I had other issues with it as well.Some people are claiming the device is slow especially when buffering utube. I have not seen any difference in speed from my iPad 3. As far as gaming goes words with friends is the only game I play and it works flawlessly on the mini. Perhaps if your buying the iPad for gaming you would be happier with the iPad 4 ( or whatever they are calling it) because it has more RAM and a faster processor.The form factor of theMini is simply amazing, I honestly can't complain about the lack of retina because I think that's too much to ask right now for any manufacturer to get into such a slim and light package. You honestly can't truly understand how amazing this thing is until you have used an iPad 3 for a significant amount of time, the weight and bulk gets to you. The iPad mini fits so well into my purse and I can hold it easily for hours with one hand. I can read and rock my child to sleep at the same time now!You should only get the wifi version unless you have a share everything plan as my husband and I do, then you can ad your tablet on for a low fee to your existing plan. I would never pay 30 dollars a month for a separate plan. I love that you can use FaceTime over the 3G or 4G, I tuck this into my purse and if my son is doing something particularly cute on the playground during daddies lunch break we can call him and say "hi".As far as cases go, I am a minimalist so I love the Smart Cover paired with a clear plastic back so I don't cover up the beauty of my mini. The Smart Cover is different from my iPad 3 smart over, the hinge does to have any metal showing and it snaps on tighter and looks much nicer. I tried the Griffin thin case folio (I think that was what it's called) it was really nice looking but when the mini was in it it didn't lie flat hindering some of my key presses on the outer edge of the device. I recently read a review on this product and the man raved about it, so maybe I just got a faulty case.Apple care+ feels like a must on this device. Because I will be carrying this wherever I go and because its so slim I want to cover my a** if I drop this beautiful piece of equipment. If I bought the 16GB wifi only version I might not pay the extra dough for AppleCare +.The speakers really surprised me on this little device, they are loud and clear! I still wish Apple would include headphones in every package as well as an adapter for the new power connector (we all know Apple is stingy) but they don't.I am really excited about this device, I could have saved money and purchased a google nexus 7 or any one of the other 7 inch devices but their battery life, build quality, and battery life are inferior to the mini. (Yes I am sure someone will send a nasty comment when they read this about me being an isheep) I don't stand behind a product simply because it is made by a certain company, I stand behind a product when it is a damn good product. I recognize the mini has some shortcomings but they far outweigh the greatness of this beautiful product.

Reviews.Title: Sealed in original box indeed
Reviews.Author: BobT
Reviews.Content: Excellent delivery as promised and ALL arrived in original SEALED box as advertised. Significant improvement of the retina resolution as compared to iPad 2, though a little heavier. No problem to use the sleeve bought previously for iPad 2.

Reviews.Title: My first but not my last
Reviews.Author: Plain Jane
Reviews.Content: This is a great product with instant delivery - in fact, an unbelieveably short time.The clarity is sharp and colorful. Easy to use even for an old soldier like me.

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: Marlene Dorenkamp "mmranch"
Reviews.Content: I held off buying an iPad until I saw people taking pictures with it.  Wish the photo quality was better and also wish it would sync with my Kindle, but otherwise I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great condition!
Reviews.Author: Marc A. LaLama
Reviews.Content: The product arrived on time and in great condition. I would recommend this product for anyone who is looking for something that is more portable than a laptop but bigger than a smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Its an iPad..
Reviews.Author: Neha
Reviews.Content: I have been using iPad since 6 months..Its just nice... I compared ipad 2 and ipad 3 in stores.. Well after seeing ipad3, ipad2 doesnt suit your hand.. LOL... Screen quality is awesome. Even if you zoom, text appears clearly.Battery life is good. Accessory awesome. Applications are good. I didnt yet upgraded to iOS 6. Waiting for right moment!! Then will update the review.From the seller we got the shipment too fast. Although it said, estimated date was 20 days after we order..But we got in 3 days. This is our second iPad. Both working great!!

Reviews.Title: iPad
Reviews.Author: Linda A. Mccall "nursemccall"
Reviews.Content: This is the best purchase I've ever made and amazon made it possible.  I have had galaxy's for years and I really loved them and have nothing bad to say. This iPad is the ultimate. The only thing I don't like is not having "flash". Looks like apple , as big as they are, could find a way to add "flash".

Reviews.Title: Best tablet in the market
Reviews.Author: nick
Reviews.Content: Screen resolution, battery life, sound clarity, the apps to choose....what not, everything is incredible about this iPad. The only thing I'm missing right now is YouTube app for iPad. Hope it comes directly with the iOS 6.0.

Reviews.Title: First iPad and Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Lady At The Lake
Reviews.Content: I had been thinking about getting one of these after I saw our Realtor using one. This is substantial in weight compared to the Kindle, but not so heavy that it's annoying. It can slip into a tote purse easily.I highly suggest getting a protective cover for it. I have the magnetic one from the Apple store which is nice for the front, but does nothing for the back.  So be careful when carrying it around or maybe check out the Targus cover.DH has the Kindle which is a good size for him just reading "books" and he has the Targus cover which is so nice.Back to iPad - it's my first and I love the display - it's gorgeous. Fingerprints do show up, so I got the cleaning kit from the Apple store to keep it looking nice (solution and cloth).I simply use this for browsing or reading in bed and I love how you can size and resize the text instantly by pinching open or closed and moving down/up the page quickly.Get a stylus. We have the Targus which is like a little pen with a small "balloon" on the end for tapping/selecting. I wish the stylus was a bit more pointy or small, because sometimes I have to resize the text before using the stylus for selecting. If I had to use a finger all the time, I'd be resizing a lot more.This is not a toy for little children (obviously), as the price is up there and if dropped, oops.  We did get the protection plan, but haven't had to use it.Haven't used Facetime, but if more of the family gets with iPad, then it will be wonderful for staying in touch.This is our first Apple purchase and I'm impressed at the ease of usage. Down the road, I'd like an Apple computer.

Reviews.Title: Best ever
Reviews.Author: Janice Willis "grandmother"
Reviews.Content: The Ipad was. Every thing I expected. I held off from getting one as long as I could but glad I made the decision.

Reviews.Title: I like it, but wish it had some Android-like features
Reviews.Author: Kene_J
Reviews.Content: I picked this up a little over 2 weeks ago at my local Best Buy and really wasn't impressed when I started using it. I always wondered why there was so much hype surrounding Apple products. It's a beautiful tablet, both the body and the screen. I just thought Apple would've shaken things up a bit instead of using the same mundane icon layout etc. The good thing is that it gets the work done that I need, the extras that I want are just not there. For example, no auto-fill when typing URL's, lack of Flash player, no built in HDMI port, no notepad for me to write on unlike the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 and the so-so sound quality. I've gotta tell ya, the Kindle HD sounds way better. There are some other features I wish the iPad had, but I won't get into that.What I'll say is that I like the sturdiness. It feels like they used good quality material to construct this. Battery life is simply amazing, I rarely need to charge it. It connects quickly to the internet. I like the sharp retina display, the ease of transitioning from one app or website to another. It's very smooth, the best I've seen in any tablet and I've purchased and returned a few in my quest to find a really good one (Kindle Fire HD, Blackberry Playbook, Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 & the Asus Transformer TF700T). I think Apple got me by the sheer volume of apps they have and so many of them are free! It's amazing to have such a vast array of apps that are dedicated to this one product.I like it enough to keep it plus I'm tired of returning tablets. I'll just have to learn how to manipulate it. The owner's manual online should really help with this.

Reviews.Title: First iPad and Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Lady At The Lake
Reviews.Content: I had been thinking about getting one of these after I saw our Realtor using one. This is substantial in weight compared to the Kindle, but not so heavy that it's annoying. It can slip into a tote purse easily.I highly suggest getting a protective cover for it. I have the magnetic one from the Apple store which is nice for the front, but does nothing for the back.  So be careful when carrying it around or maybe check out the Targus cover.DH has the Kindle which is a good size for him just reading "books" and he has the Targus cover which is so nice.Back to iPad - it's my first and I love the display - it's gorgeous. Fingerprints do show up, so I got the cleaning kit from the Apple store to keep it looking nice (solution and cloth).I simply use this for browsing or reading in bed and I love how you can size and resize the text instantly by pinching open or closed and moving down/up the page quickly.Get a stylus. We have the Targus which is like a little pen with a small "balloon" on the end for tapping/selecting. I wish the stylus was a bit more pointy or small, because sometimes I have to resize the text before using the stylus for selecting. If I had to use a finger all the time, I'd be resizing a lot more.This is not a toy for little children (obviously), as the price is up there and if dropped, oops.  We did get the protection plan, but haven't had to use it.Haven't used Facetime, but if more of the family gets with iPad, then it will be wonderful for staying in touch.This is our first Apple purchase and I'm impressed at the ease of usage. Down the road, I'd like an Apple computer.

Reviews.Title: Best ever
Reviews.Author: Janice Willis "grandmother"
Reviews.Content: The Ipad was. Every thing I expected. I held off from getting one as long as I could but glad I made the decision.

Reviews.Title: I like it, but wish it had some Android-like features
Reviews.Author: Kene_J
Reviews.Content: I picked this up a little over 2 weeks ago at my local Best Buy and really wasn't impressed when I started using it. I always wondered why there was so much hype surrounding Apple products. It's a beautiful tablet, both the body and the screen. I just thought Apple would've shaken things up a bit instead of using the same mundane icon layout etc. The good thing is that it gets the work done that I need, the extras that I want are just not there. For example, no auto-fill when typing URL's, lack of Flash player, no built in HDMI port, no notepad for me to write on unlike the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 and the so-so sound quality. I've gotta tell ya, the Kindle HD sounds way better. There are some other features I wish the iPad had, but I won't get into that.What I'll say is that I like the sturdiness. It feels like they used good quality material to construct this. Battery life is simply amazing, I rarely need to charge it. It connects quickly to the internet. I like the sharp retina display, the ease of transitioning from one app or website to another. It's very smooth, the best I've seen in any tablet and I've purchased and returned a few in my quest to find a really good one (Kindle Fire HD, Blackberry Playbook, Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 & the Asus Transformer TF700T). I think Apple got me by the sheer volume of apps they have and so many of them are free! It's amazing to have such a vast array of apps that are dedicated to this one product.I like it enough to keep it plus I'm tired of returning tablets. I'll just have to learn how to manipulate it. The owner's manual online should really help with this.

Reviews.Title: Just 1 thought. Ameeeeeezzzzing.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: D. Davis "Painter"
Reviews.Content: I am not an Apple lover. I wanted to get a tablet PC due to the portability and convenience. Family and friends use and like the iPad. They speak highly of it, therefore, I decided to try out the iPad as opposed to the Samsung Galaxy Note.Things I like: The iPad is light, convenient, the screen resolution is great. It is pretty easy to use, connects with wireless sites with ease and no hassle, the battery life is great.Things I dont like: There is no "arrow key" to move the cursor backward, forward, up or down to position the cursor where you want it to correct spelling or add words. The backspace "key" is the only way to move the cursor and it erases characters. The touch screen allows you to place the cursor where you want it, but it isn't always responsive to my attempts to place the cursor where I want it; so this too can be awkward for making corrections etc. I ordered a stylus. I hope the stylus will make this a little more tolerable. Bookmarks are weird. I have used Safari. Chrome, Yahoo Axis and none handle bookmarks very well. I suppose it is something I need to get used to.

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet - a hdtv in your hand
Reviews.Author: SP
Reviews.Content: I was almost considering the iPad2 for portability but ended up getting  an 11inch macbook air last year.  Yet with all the convenience a tablet has over a  laptop  I've been waiting for this retina screen and pre ordered  my first tablet a Black 16Gb 4G At&t; on the first day of release. Glad to have skipped the earlier 2 Gen's of iPad.With just few hours  of usage, I realized how convenient it is for everyday browsing and entertainment.  Retina screen really made a huge difference.  It truly appears like an hdtv in your hand. Definitely recommend buying it. For some reasons I've always  tried to stay away from  Apple products due to their higher  price etc.,  But over years, I find myself  accumulating Apple products  starting with my first purchase a 3rd gen Nano to  this current iPad 3.  I feel their products  are really designed for convenience, there is so much attention given to minor  things that other brands do not care about.  This factor alone makes me forget about their price.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, horrible sellers.
Reviews.Author: Kevin "USA"
Reviews.Content: I won't go ahead and give this tablet a 1 star rating because of all the no-life sellers selling this for way above retail even when there's tons here In the Tampa Bay area so I'm sure there are many everywhere else.Pros:The screen, I cannot stretch this enough, this should be a selling point right when you pick one up, it is INSANE how sharp it looks, plus all apps have been updated to accept this new native resolution on the retina display.The 5 MP camera creates a great depth of fielt but obviously not as great as you'd see on a DSLR ;) It's as good as it gets mobile wise. Personally, I will not be using the iPad to take pictures as I laugh at people who use their tablets to take pictures, they look ridiculous.Good feel and size - I'm one of the rare few that likes their items to have a good weight to them because it proves that they have value to them, like pick up a Walmart watch then a Michael Kors watch and you'll know what I'm talking aboutDictation - It's nice and accurate, old technology, nothing to see here folks.Elegant looks - Of course it looks breathtaking compared to any tablet out there, it is sleek and simple.Cons:Still no smaller model, this is not a personal concern but yeah for all the whiners out thereStill no headphones - is it that hard to include them apple? Come on...A5X processor - You would think being a 1gb dual core with quad core graphics processor that it would blow the A5 out of the water? It actually got a point lower than the iPad 2 ( 720 vs 721) disappointing.To sum it up really, if you have an iPad 2, do not upgrade, if you have the original PLEASE do. If this is your first Apple tablet or first tablet at all, buy it. I say this because it is simple and straight forward, other tablets try to be so unique that they make everything a buggy mess and lag so much.

I really don't see how anyone could be disappointed purchasing the new iPad.***Update***. Still  in love with this display - if you take pics with a high end camera and view on your new iPad they appear to hover over the display.  I haven't had any issues with heat or battery.  It gets a little warmer and depletes the battery a little faster than my iPad 2 but it isn't enough of a difference to be a problem.  Everything runs just as smoothly as on my ipad2.  I can't wait for more "retina-optimized" apps to come out!

Reviews.Title: A wonderful Tablet and great Apple Quality
Reviews.Author: Diana De Avila "MS Gkygrl"
Reviews.Content: I pre-ordered the 3rd Generation Apple iPad after being a relatively early adopter of the original iPad.  I loved the original iPad and have used it for productivity and fun.I decided to wait for the 3rd generation iPad and am glad I did.  It sports a 5 megapixal camera and video camera capability with the beautiful retina display (which I have on my iPhone 4).  The design and curves are the same as the 2nd generation iPad, so iPad 2 cases should fit this iPad without a hitch.  I purchased the rooCASE Convertible Premium Leather (Red) Case Cover with 24 Angle Adjustable Stand for Apple iPad 2 / iPad 3 / The new iPad and it's been a nice protector although I am a fan of the Otterbox iPad 2 Defender Case - Black.Overall, if you are a fan of iPad (or Apple in general) and have the iPad first Generation, you will notice a nice change.  If you have the iPad 2 and were thinking of upgrading to the latest model ... you may want to just hold off.  The differences are in the chip and the camera quality and display.  Depending on how you use your iPad (power user like me or casual user), that will help you to judge.I think the switch from first Generation to third Generation iPad is definitely a great and worthy leap.  I would question the switch from 2nd Gen to 3rd Gen if you are just a casual user.  Truth is, from the outside ... you won't really know the difference.  In this case, it's the guts that make all the difference.I love it!  5 stars.

Reviews.Title: APPLE IPAD PRODUCTS SUCK!
Reviews.Author: Gary Johnson
Reviews.Content: I have owned a first generation Ipad since its release.  Apple wants you to follow the philosophy of buy new every time they invent something.  Well, these products have a LIFE CYCLE of at least 125 years, not including the battery.  So why would you need to buy a new product every year when you already have a working product, because APPLE WANTS YOUR MONEY!  They do not want to fix their pieces of S***, because that does not look good for their bottom line.  Have you ever had your IPAD just shutdown a APP, well this is because the POS, has a memory management issue APPLE does not want to fix in older issues.  Would I recommend this product to anyone wanting to USE the product.  If you have a limited application use then its OK, but when its starts shutting down cut down on its feeble usage because you have exceeded its capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Definitely a premium product for a premium price
Reviews.Author: CyberiumElite
Reviews.Content: I received my refurbished iPad 3rd generation from Web Marketing Direct for $330. It was definitely a good deal, considering the device had minimal damage and a newly replaced screen. I was set on getting the 3rd generation since it included the Retina Display without having the infamous lightning dock connector found on the newer iPad. All in all, I was very pleased with the item I received, now on to the actual device:Screen:I didn't believe all the hype at first about the Retina display, but in fact it is all true. The display is definitely stunning and features probably the best screen on any tablet, although I think the Google Nexus 10 still wins in terms of pure sharpness.Build:As stated in the review's title, you can definitely feel the premium material that was used to put this device together. I wouldn't go so far as to call it durable though, which is why I recommend you get a case and screen protector.OS:Here is where the iPad falls short. At least for now, Apple's iOS 6 is the iPad's most visible weakness. It looks and feels stale, despite the iPad's beautiful screen. The static icons just don't cut it anymore, especially if you have used Android 4.0 or above on a tablet. Hopefully iOS 7 will improve upon the software, but from the initial previews it seems to be more or less the same.Battery Life:This is where the iPad excels most notably. The 10 hour reported battery life proves to be all but true, even with the brightness and high levels. The fact that iOS is extremely simple with little to no graphical animations is what optimizes the iPad's great battery life.Productivity:I know that most people buy tablets for recreational use, but sometimes people choose to integrate it with their work life through e-mail and word processing. Unfortunately, the iPad isn't really great for either, considering that the keyboard accessories from most manufacturers are overpriced and Apple's own iWork suite is far too minimal at a high price. Also, true multitasking with multi-window support is just not present and further shows iOS' limitations.Overall, the Apple iPad is a great device for media consumption while delivering excellent battery life. If you are not able to fork up the heavy price, there are definitely cheaper options available such as the Google Nexus 10 but they arguably don't offer the same 'premium' look and feel as the iPad does.

Reviews.Title: It's amazing to live in the 21st century
Reviews.Author: Titan of Ice "icetitan"
Reviews.Content: I owned an iPod Touch prior to the iPad, which gave me a taste of the iPad's capabilities.  Now that I've experienced it, it's very hard to go back to using the Touch or even a laptop computer.  I worried initially about portability, but even with a sturdy case (which, as is typical of these delicate Apple products, is a must), it's no more bulky than a midsized hardcover book.  The graphics are crisp and beautiful and the wifi performance has thus far been flawless.  The battery life has been one of the biggest surprises thus far.  Even with moderate use, I only need to charge it twice a week.  It's amazing that everything I want is here at my fingertips--pictures, video, email, web browsing, music, games, and books.  Yes, books, another great suprise.  Reading books on iBooks or the free Kindle app is little different from reading a page of texts.  I had my doubts about this, but now I'm a believer, especially given the overwhelming amount of cheap or free ebook literature that's now available.  These are all things I only dreamed about as a kid some 30 years ago.  It is truly amazing to live in the 21st century.

Reviews.Title: Ipad is as advertised
Reviews.Author: Tom Jones "FDXTOM"
Reviews.Content: While I never bought into the Apple hype, I am impressed with the ipad and the applications it has available. The fact that I have a android tablet (Asus tf300) allowed me to compare the ipad with what I would call a worthy Android contender. While the Android is nice because of the ability to add SD cards, plug in usb peripherals and has a keyboard that attaches nicely and turns it into a "netbook",I found the applications and support on the android device to be a little weak. A example is Direct TV has a app for Ipad to stream video, The Android has a app, but it does not work to stream video on my device the Asus tf300. A second example is the Good client for enterprise allows us to access email and securely browse the intranet outside of the office which works pretty good for the Ipad, but the android app lacks the secure browser functionality for Android jelly bean OS.

Reviews.Title: Great price

Reviews.Content: It is for my daughter for Christmas, and I can't wait to see her face when she opens it! Merry Christmas!

Reviews.Title: New generation iPad - a worthy investment
Reviews.Author: D. Summerson "Happy Camper"
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift first part of November.  I have not owned any Apple products before but this is a nice experience for me.  I have had no issues with it operating at all.  The battery life is good and picture quality is great.  I now use Facetime with my kids who are in college out of state and it just works and works well, even in low light.  One thing that would be nice to have corrected in this IOS is to be able to minimize a program without having to close it.  This is a problem when I want to check another program and go back to the one that was opened.  I always have to restart the program again which is a pain if I was on a certain page.  Other than that, this device picks up wireless signals very well.  Even when they show a weak signal on another device the signal strength on the iPad is better.  If you want the tablet that all others try to emulate, you will not be disappointed with this one.

Reviews.Title: Good E-Reader/Photframe. Not for Movies/dynamic content.
Reviews.Author: Jay Thomas
Reviews.Content: I use I phone. I liked it. the GUI and the build quality. I thought I give it a try with Ipad.I tried android tabs for comparsionThese are my findings. This is keeping performance/ eccosystem support etc appart.- It looks like a huge phone. The static icon based UI which is same as iphone's looks toyish. The GUI is not suitable for a serious device for this size. It industrial design the GUI has the toyish look and feel. Apple products excpet iphone and mackbook pro has this problem of toyish look.- The aspect ratio of the screen. lack of 16:9 robes the entertainment of movie watching or consuming media. This is a big draw back. netflix movies look way better in Toshiba or any other android tab. With the added resolution this is more of a high resolution e-reader. in which it excels. or for viewing still photos. Motion picutre doesnt have the movie feeling but feel like viewing an ameture clipping. You wont enjoy the movie as much on an android device.- For vedeo content this DPi is redudant. Movies / videos doesnt require that pixel density. This is very much suitable as a photo frame. book reader. orgraphs . prductivity tool for ptohgrpahers etc. not good for video. The frame rates for the movies/videos seems to be diffrernt it feels again like amaterurish or a video clip feeling to it. Movies are not rendered in standards movie frame rate. It looks busy like a home video. The screen also looks unnaturally bright more of a clinical appearance.- The Screen colour gamut is not neutral. Its too busy or reddish. Transormer pad/ Toshiba has neutral/natural color for movies and regular websites. At first it may look vibrant and striking. But in long use it's too artificial boosting of colors or contrast and brighneess.- The GUI lacks the dynamic feel which adds feel to the overall veiwing media consumption experience. This GUI is at best good for a phone size device.- The build quality. Material quality is superior. The performance / the touch interface is superior as usual.- Overall design the OS/GUI are not built towards media or video experience rather for static content viewing of for games. If you are not watching movies or other media but mostly use this for still , photo sharing, e-bbok reading, games etc then this is a good fit. For anyting dynamic content this doesnt just have the feel.

Reviews.Title: Good to have for Kindle, "webbing" and emailing
Reviews.Author: Jim Schmidt "Jimmbbo"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Apple product, so it's been a voyage of adventure...PROSBuild quality and ergonomics are first rate - a truly high quality product.The Retina display screen is exceptionally sharp and clear when compared to a friend's "iPad 2".Relatively crash proof and simple to operate (once the "operations code" is broken)Choice of applications is truly mindbending, likely the best feature of the unitSeamless updating and syncing with iTunesCONSApple's thought processes and symbology are different from PC developers, so there has been a learning curve for moi...  I can move around and activate any feature on any Windows PC without a hitch...  Apple has its own way of doing business...iPad "multitasking" is brain dead compared to Windows machines, and the inability to use Flash based websites due to the Apple/Adobe feud is asinine.  Fortunately, an app named iSwifter allows Flash based content to play on the iPad, so all is not totally lost, but iSwifter is not particularly user friendly.Recharging time seems to be long, compared to an ASUS netbook and a pair of HP laptops I haveAm unable to charge the iPad via the PC-to-iPad USBHaving problems updating apps via the iPad... have to update on my PC, then sync with the iPad...  minor annoyanceHas a proprietary power/docking connector, but converter cables to HDMI or USB are available.I enjoy using the iPad for webbing and email access nearly anywhere, plus the apps that figuratively and literally make the iPad sing.  Not new to an Apple-phile, but is really great for a newbie.Overall, am glad I purchased the iPad, and look forward to learning more about how it runs best...6 MONTH UPDATE - Upgraded from 4 to 5 stars. Am more comfortable using the Apple operating system and the logic they use to drive the machine... The problem with uploading apps disappeared with an OS update, now works seamlessly.  Using it most for Kindle reader or accessing email without having to boot my laptop or desktop PC.  Glad I purchased it....

Reviews.Title: New IPAD
Reviews.Author: VERNETTA DORRIS
Reviews.Content: I love my new ipad.  I use it every day and it is so easy to get around with it.  I am shocked that it did not come with a hard case or any screen protectors for a thousand dollars though.

Reviews.Title: Wi-Fi does not work
Reviews.Author: T. M. Burns
Reviews.Content: The "new iPad" is pure junk and I would not recommend to anybody. The main issue is the Wi-Fi which simply does not work. I have an iPad 2, iPhone, and a Wi-Fi television we watch Netflix on. Each on these units receive Wi-Fi signals without problems (they are all within 5 feet of each other) but not the "new iPad". I got this for my wife who is recently wheelchair bound so she could check her email, surf the Internet, and play games. The only thing it is good for is playing games, which does not require a Wi-Fi connection.I am going to contact Amazon about returning, I would take it to an Apple store but cannot leave my wife.  If you have the misfortune of purchasing one of these I wish you good luck.

Reviews.Title: Great---but still not quite ready to be amazing
Reviews.Author: Ryan D
Reviews.Content: Tablets are, arguably, luxury toys for rich people. They are cool toys, but the truth is tablets aren't yet QUITE as amazing as they need to be to fully justify their price and status.The screen. Let's take the glass half empty view. A 9.7 inch screen is still a small screen compared with a laptop or desktop. Only the prevalence of smarphones allows us to perceive it as big. Ten years ago what would people have said about an amazing computer---with a big 9.7 inch screen! And it costs more than many desktops! And 264 pixels per inch is record breaking for a medium/small screen screen but it's still low compared with almost all modern smartphones. So its screen lacks the size of a desktop or laptop screen and it lacks the extreme clarity of a smartphone screen. You COULD argue it's the worst of both worlds.If and when tablets move to 300 pixels per inch, they will be truly amazing, mind blowing, earth shattering devices. Ultra clarity like a smartphone but much more size! Such devices might be so amazing that they cause smartphones to go extinct.In the meantime, while the new iPad is a major step in the right direction, it's still not quite ready--like a Thanksgiving turkey that was taken out of the oven just a bit too early.

Reviews.Title: iPad3 will not charge
Reviews.Author: Disappointed!
Reviews.Content: My daughter received this product yesterday, used it for a few hours, now it will not charge. Completely unacceptable. For spending $600 on it, it should work flawlessly. Really disappointing. Now I have to hassle with taking it to a service center.

Reviews.Title: Flawless functionality, bad assambling
Reviews.Author: Yosue Caridad
Reviews.Content: The reason why i give 2 stars is just because my ipad came with some breaks over the plastic antenna and it bothers me because i live in another country and cant take it back. If i would live in US, ill take it back for sure. I paid a lot of money and i dont accept this kind of fails.Im a very partial reviewer and i like to give good reviews based on personal expirience, im sorry that with this case particulary (with the second most expensive item i bought in amazon so far) i cant give a full 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Hate it
Reviews.Author: Mike Bradley
Reviews.Content: I absolutely hate it. It's basic architecture is such that apps can't communicate productively with each other. As a result, every app has to duplicate computer-like sharing functions that would be trivial in a real computer. Most of the time, they do a miserable job of it. The screen is the best touch screen, so I've read, but that isn't saying much. You often have to keep whacking away at the screen to get it to respond and often the response is for the icon next to the one you're whacking. The whole touch screen user interface is remarkable, but it's very limited. It's simply impossible to make a screen icon or label for even the limited number of actions you can take; the actions for which there's no label/icon are basically secret. You may stumble over them, you may not. You certainly will never have the functionality of a real computer.In spite of all the problems of the iPad and its imitators, many people buy them. If you limit yourself to simple email handling, on the level of what we had 30+ years ago before the web, taking pictures, and browsing web sites while not using them to do much, I suppose the iPad is a decent enough choice. But don't buy a new one. The used ones are half the price and they're in terrific condition.

They said the device is not registered not authorized with apple so they cannot do anything. I don't know where the seller get the product but it is certainly not right. Reviews.Title: User guide issues.
Reviews.Author: Leslie Hall
Reviews.Content: My only comment about all tech things, ie. tablets, smart phones etc. is that the manufacturers assume that the only people who buy these things are the 10 year old to 30 something year old set who were raised on computers and tech gadgets.  The user guide is pretty much worthless to the rest of us.  I haven't been able to even connect the blasted thing properly to my computer thus have been unable to use it.  I was hoping to become more up to date...it seemed the whole world owned a tablet except me.  I know that once I get it all figured out it will be cool...but getting there is the hard part.  Today I go to visit my 14 year old neice...she will get it up and running.  I feel so dumb when it comes to tech stuff...and even dumber when I can't understand the user guide - which by the way is so small it fits into the palm of your hand, meaning that the type needs to be read with a magnifying glass.....and I'm hardly old at 53...or am I?  Again, once it all gets figured out I'm sure I'm going to like it a lot.

I have been satisfied with it for what it is; typing on it of course is slower than an actual keyboard and the lack of flash support is still annoying, yet over all I've been enjoying it and have found that it works very well for those quick tasks so I don't have to boot up my laptop or deal with the small screen on my phone. Overall, if you're willing to pay the money and want Apple, this new iPad is good.

Reviews.Title: Insanely fast, easy to use, productive, and most important of all, fun.
Reviews.Author: Justin Wallace
Reviews.Content: This review is coming from a person who bought the original iPad and did not upgrade to the iPad 2 when it came out.The iPad is a remarkable device. I find it to be much more useful than any laptop out there for many reasons, including portability, application availability, and ease of use.One reason why the iPad is so fast compared to laptops is due to the fact that it uses flash storage memory, or in other words, there are no moving parts inside the device, like a laptop would have with a typical moving hard drive that would eventually die after X number of years.I am not an Apple fanboy. I do see where they have some flaws. But if you're wondering if the iPad is worth the money, it absolutely is. You get what you pay for, and the iPad is a perfect example of it.I skipped the iPad 2 because they did not come out with the retina display, which makes everything, most notably text, much more sharp then it has been previously. If you do any fair amount of reading on the device, you need to get the third generation iPad, and don't look at the previous models. It will be entirely worth it, and you will not look back or regret your decision.And for the people who are confused why Apple chose not to name this device the iPad 3, I would like to help with a brief explanation. Apple currently has many products where they do not have a numbering system in the official title of the device, like the iPod, iPod touch, MacBook, MacBook Pro, Apple TV, and so on. It's simply labeled just with the title of the device, and the way people distinguish it from previous models is to simply refer to it as the first, second or third generation, etc. Evidently they are going to do this with the iPad now as well, and you can count on the fact that the next iPhone that will be released will not be called the iPhone 5. :-) I partially digress, but for the people who are wondering about this with any possible confusion, I hope this clears some of it up.I could get into all of the features that it has, but if you're looking for an overall device that does everything extremely well and fast, look no more and get this third generation iPad. It's easy to use and fast, but most importantly, it is fun and productive.

Reviews.Title: A comparision with Samsung Galaxy Tab 8.9
Reviews.Author: L. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: I have a Samsung Galaxy Tab 8.9 and love it.  Decided to try the new iPad and would like to offer some comparisons.Display - The iPad's display is certainly sharper than the Tab, but not by much.Display size - I prefer the 8.9 size to the iPad's larger screen. Simply easier to carry around.  iPad better for reading magazines but prefer the Tab for almost everything else. Really a matter of preference.Speed - iPad is faster.Heat - I live in a warm climate and find the iPad runs hot at times.  No problem with the Galaxy Tab.Build quality - About the same.  iPad may be a bit better but Galaxy Tab is also well made.Weight - The Tab is feather light, being less than a pound.  The iPad feels like a tank in comparison, a major disadvantage.Apps - Although the iPad has significantly more apps, the Android system is starting to catch up. So far, I have found everything I need on the Android app  stores.Interface - A matter of preference.  I appreciate the tightness of the IOS but prefer the openness and flexibility of the Android operating system.Bottom line.  Most people flock to the iPad because it is the best known and best integrated of the tablets.  However, the Samsung Galaxy Tab 8.9 offers some advantages in size, weight and flexibility. Haven't decided whether or not to keep the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Apple customer service sucks.

So once again the customer suffers.By the way, Apple should treat it's workers with a lot more respect. When workers start jumping off tall buildings, maybe you could give them a short break.
